titleelement.b203: Chemistry of Heterocyclic Compounds: A Series Of Monographs

textcontent.d104: The Chemistry of Heterocyclic Compounds, since its inception, has been recognized as a cornerstone of heterocyclic chemistry. Each volume attempts to discuss all aspects – properties, synthesis, reactions, physiological and industrial significance – of a specific ring system. To keep the series up-to-date, supplementary volumes covering the recent literature on each individual ring system have been published. Many ring systems (such as pyridines and oxazoles) are treated in distinct books, each consisting of separate volumes or parts dealing with different individual topics. With all authors are recognized authorities, the Chemistry of Heterocyclic Chemistry is considered worldwide as the indispensable resource for organic, bioorganic, and medicinal chemists.

Properties and Reactions of Isoquinolines and Their Hydrogenated Derivatives (S. F. Dyke and R. G.

Kinsman).

Synthetic and Natural Sources of the Isoquinoline Nucleus (T. J. Kametani and K. Fukumoto).

Biosynthesis of Isoquinolines (E. McDonald).

Quaternary Isoquinolinium Compounds (C. K. Bradsher).

Isoquinolinols and Isoquinoline Thiols and Their Hydrogenated Derivatives (B. Umezawa and O. Hoshino).

Halogenated and Metallated Isoquinolines and Their Hydrogenated Derivatives (M. D. Nair).

Alkyl, Alkenyl, Alkinyl, and Aryl Isoquinolines and Their Hydrogenated Derivatives (J. L. Neumeyer and B. C.

Uff).

Benzylisoquinolines and Their Hydrogenated Derivatives (W. Wiegrebe).

Isoquinolines Containing Alcohol, Aldehyde, and Ketone Functions, Their Thio and Hydrogenated Derivatives (E. M. Kaiser and P. L.

Knutson).

Isoquinoline Carboxylic Acids and Derivatives and Their Hydrogenated Derivatives (F. D. Popp).

Isoquinolines Containing Basic Functions at the Ring and Their Hydrogenated Derivatives (I. W. Mathison).

Isoquinolines Containing Basic Functions in the Side Chains and Their Hydrogenated Derivatives (F. Kathawala and H. Schuster).

Isoquinolines Containing Oxidized Nitrogen Functions and Their Hydrogenated Derivatives (J. W. Bunting).

Isoquinolones and Their Hydrogenated Derivatives (N. J. McCorkindale).

Isoquinolines Containing One Added Ring (F. P. Hauck).

Isoquinolines Containing Two Added Rings (W. S. Saari and K. Shepard).

Isoquinolines Containing Three Added Rings (T. J. Schwan and H. R.

Snyder, Jr.).

Isoquinolines Containing More Than Three Added Rings (P. H. Grayshan and J. V.

Greenhill).
